Award.AwardTitle: I-Corps: Integrated framework for risk assessment for catastrophic natural disasters
Award.AbstractNarration:
The proposed service provides risk assessment for catastrophic natural disasters such as landslides, mudslides, volcanic avalanches, snow avalanche and related mass flows systems. This will help insurance and reinsurance companies improve their risk assessment by creating high-fidelity risk assessment of natural hazards, and to be more competitive on the market by using products that will incorporate innovative and recently developed methods. Such assessments are of great use to many stakeholders, planners, large risk analysis providers, government agencies (local, state, federal and international), trading.

The economic costs of natural disasters in the United States have been increasing in recent decades. The proposed work can help public safety officials as well insurance companies and construction developers, by delivering risk modeling and bring predictability to the outcome of these natural disasters. Low probability events with potentially catastrophic consequences such as mudslides, landslides, snow avalanches and pyroclastic flows are among the extreme events that are the focus of the proposed service.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The primary objective of the proposed work was to commercialize tools for hazard analysis based on novel strategies (part of co-I Stefanescu dissertationresearch) for constructing emulators for large-scale data from simulation and observation using a combination of efficient sparse representations and multilevel methodology. The focus of this project was to scale and transform these innovations into market ready tools by surmounting a series of challenges in creating the core multilevel strategy for complex time dependent data sets and the challenges in organizing the complex computations.

The market discovery and customer validation processes led to the focusing of the product definition that will be the starting point for the company's product line. Industry partners (Buffalo Computer Graphics, Inc., a NY state contract holder for emergency management services) and business advisors (Tino Bellanca and Associates) identified during this process will participate in this project to help scale and take our innovative strategies to market. Core ideas underlying this project were also in co-I Stefanescu's successful entries in several businessplan competitions (Panasci, Google Women Enterpreneurs Bootcamp, eLab).

 

Market discovery under this iCORPS funding reveals that there are a large number of state and local government entities, insurance/reinsurance companies (e.g. Zurich Re, All State, Platinum Re etc.) and risk modeling consultancies (RMS, AIR, EqeCat) that have interest in these ideas but require demonstration of routine operation at scale with complex data sets and a customer usable toolset. After establishing a company ERS Inc. work is ongoing along woth partner company (Buffalo Computer GRaphics) to establish this capability and serve this clientele efficiently.
